name: ITP003 - Stripping Top Soil and Bulk Excavation
template name: ITP003 - Stripping Top Soil and Bulk Excavation - Rev A

name: Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
○ Using the correct and complete set of drawings.
○ All drawings are the latest revision
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS and WP.
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Area has been surveyed, highlighting any areas where excavations should not occur (e.g. exclusion zone).
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation permit issued. If working near HV electrical, an Electricity supply Isolation form and cabling permit has been issued from Melbourne Airport.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Fulton Hogan Excavation permit issued to plant operators prior to excavation works. Native Grass heatmap issued and boundary of working area has been set out.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Plant and Equipment used in the works are appropriate to achieve specifications requirements. All plant inducted and inspected as per Fulton Hogan’s plant safety guidelines.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - All excavation and filling will be free draining to low points clear of the Works. Sufficient pumps, well-points or other equipment for work area de-watered during the works shall be provided where required. Existing drainage lines and water mains found to be traversing the site must be removed as shown on drawings. Contractor must provide temporary pollution control devices or ponds in existing drainage systems and receiving waters.
Reference Documents - ZULU- BECA-001- DWG-00001 to ZULU- BECA-005- DWG-01119
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Prevention of dust during earthworks and subgrade preparation. Sweeper onsite at all times to manage dust / FOD.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Prior to bulk excavation, site shall be stripped of all topsoil and organic matter as shown on the drawings. Spoil to be taken to Gate 11.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Bulk out subgrade to 100mm of subgrade. If rain is imminent, ensure subgrade is left 100mm high prior to trimming.
○ Rocks Under <800mm can be taken as mixed fill to Gate 11
○ Rocks >800mm to be sorted and taken to Vic Civil
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - All batters to be kept at 1:1. If not, temporary support will need to be designed, engineer and approved for use.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Detail trim Subgrade with excavator / dozer
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - If contaminated or hazardous materials are found, immediate notice is to be given to the Principal’s Representative. These include the following;
○ Flammable or explosive liquids or gases;
○ Tanks or other containers which have been used for storage of explosive, toxic, infective or contaminated substances.
– Agreed removal location to be confirmed with Principles Representative.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP

On behalf of Fulton Hogan it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the items of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
